sentences: Ninnian Joseph Yule Jr. (September 23, 1920 – April 6, 2014), best known as Mickey Rooney, was an American actor, producer, radio entertainer and vaudevillian.
section: N/A

sentences: In a career spanning nine decades and continuing until his death, he appeared in more than 300 films, and was among the last surviving stars of the silent-film era.
section: N/A

sentences: He was the top box-office attraction from 1939 to 1941, and one of the best-paid actors of that era.
section: N/A

sentences: At the height of a career marked by declines and comebacks, Rooney performed the role of Andy Hardy in a series of 16 films in the 1930s and 1940s that epitomized mainstream America's self-image.
section: N/A

sentences: At the peak of his career between ages 15 and 25, he made 43 films, and was one of MGM's most consistently successful actors.
section: N/A

sentences: A versatile performer, he became a celebrated character actor later in his career.
section: N/A

sentences: Laurence Olivier once said he considered Rooney "the best there has ever been".
section: N/A

sentences: Clarence Brown, who directed him in two of his earliest dramatic roles in National Velvet and The Human Comedy, said Rooney was "the closest thing to a genius" with whom he had ever worked.

sentences: He won a Golden Globe Award in 1982 and an Emmy Award in the same year for the title role in a television movie Bill and was awarded Academy Honorary Award in 1982.

sentences: Rooney first performed in vaudeville as a child actor, and made his film debut at the age of 6 years.

sentences: He played the title character in the popular "Mickey McGuire" series of 78 short films, from age 7 to 13.
section: N/A

sentences: At 14 and 15, he played Puck in the play and subsequent film adaptation of A Midsummer Night's Dream.
section: N/A

sentences: At the age of 16 he began playing Andy Hardy, and gained first recognition at 17 as Whitey Marsh in Boys Town.
section: N/A

sentences: At only 19, Mickey Rooney became the second-youngest Best Actor in a Leading Role nominee and the first teenager to be nominated for an Academy Award for his performance as Mickey Moran in 1939 film adaptation of coming-of-age Broadway musical Babes in Arms; he was awarded a special Academy Juvenile Award in 1939.

sentences: Rooney received his second Academy Award nomination in the same category for his role as Homer Macauley in The Human Comedy.
section: N/A

sentences: Drafted into the military during World War II, Rooney served nearly two years entertaining over two million troops on stage and radio, and was awarded a Bronze Star for performing in combat zones.

== Life and acting career == | === World War II and career slump ===

sentences: In June 1944, Rooney was inducted into the United States Army, where he served more than 21 months (until shortly after the end of World War II) entertaining the troops in America and Europe in Special Services.
section: == Life and acting career == | === World War II and career slump ===

sentences: He spent part of the time as a radio personality on the American Forces Network, and was awarded the Bronze Star Medal for entertaining troops in combat zones.
section: == Life and acting career == | === World War II and career slump ===

section: == Life and acting career == | === World War II and career slump ===

== Legacy ==

sentences: Legacy ==
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Rooney was one of the last surviving actors of the silent-film era.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: His film career spanned 88 years, from 1926 to 2014, continuing until shortly before his death.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: During his peak years from the late 1930s to the early 1940s, Rooney was among the top box-office stars in the United States.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: He made 43 films between the age of 15 and 25.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Among those, his role as Andy Hardy became one of "Hollywood's best-loved characters," with Marlon Brando calling him "the best actor in films".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: "There was nothing he couldn't do," said actress Margaret O'Brien.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: MGM boss Louis B. Mayer treated him like a son and saw in Rooney "the embodiment of the amiable American boy who stands for family, humbug, and sentiment," wrote critic and author David Thomson.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: By the time Rooney was 20, his consistent portrayals of characters with youth and energy suggested that his future success was unlimited.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thomson also explains that Rooney's characters were able to cover a wide range of emotional types, and gives three examples where "Rooney is not just an actor of genius, but an artist able to maintain a stylized commentary on the demon impulse of the small, belligerent man:"
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Rooney's Puck in A Midsummer Night's Dream (1935) is truly inhuman, one of cinema's most arresting pieces of magic.
section: == Legacy ==
== Legacy ==

sentences: His toughie in Boys Town (1938) struts and bullies like something out of a nightmare
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: and then comes clean in a grotesque but utterly frank outburst of sentimentality in which he aspires to the boy community ...
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: His role as Baby Face Nelson (1957), the manic, destructive response of the runt against a pig society.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: By the end of the 1940s, Rooney's movie characters were no longer in demand, and his career went downhill.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: "In 1938," he said, "I starred in eight pictures.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: In 1948 and 1949 together, I starred in only three."
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: However, film historian Jeanine Basinger notes that although his career "reached the heights and plunged to the depths, Rooney kept on working and growing, the mark of a professional."
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Some of the films that reinvigorated his popularity were Requiem for a Heavyweight (1962), It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World (1963), and The Black Stallion (1979).
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: In the early 1980s, he returned to Broadway in Sugar Babies, and "found himself once more back on top".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Basinger tries to encapsulate Rooney's career:
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Rooney's abundant talent, like his film image, might seem like a metaphor for America: a seemingly endless supply of natural resources that could never dry up, but which, it turned out, could be ruined by excessive use and abuse, by arrogance or power, and which had to be carefully tended to be returned to full capacity.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: From child star to character actor, from movie shorts to television specials, and from films to Broadway, Rooney ultimately did prove he could do it all, do it well, and keep on doing it.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: His is a unique career, both for its versatility and its longevity.
section: == Legacy ==
